ChoiceList.pm

Go to the documentation of this file.
00001 
00002 #New highly object-oriented ChoiceList construct
00003 #This ChoiceList.pm is the super class for all types of ChoiceLists
00004 #As of 6/5/2000 the three ChoiceList sub-classes are Match, Select, Multiple
00005 #RDV
00006 
00007 =head1 NAME
00008 
00009     ChoiceList.pm  -- super-class for all ChoiceList structures
00010 
00011 =head1 SYNOPSIS
00012 
00013 =pod
00014 
00015 ChoiceList.pm is not intended to be used as a stand alone object.
00016 
00017 It is a super-class designed to be inherited by sub-classes that,
00018 through small changes, can be used for a variety of different
00019 questions that involve some sort of list of questions and/or answers.
00020 
00021 ChoiceList.pm has been used to construct Match.pm, Select.pm, and Multiple.pm.
00022 
00023 These three classes are objects that can be used to create the
00024 following question types:
00025 
00026 B<Matching list:>
00027 Given a list of questions and answers, match the correct answers to the
00028 questions. Some answers may be used more than once and some may not be used at
00029 all. The order of the answers is usually random but some answers can be
00030 appended to the end in a set order (i.e. 'None of the above'). Answers are
00031 given corresponding letters as shortcuts to typing in the full answer. (i.e.
00032 the answer to #1 is A).
00033 
00034 B<Select list:>
00035 Given a list of questions and (usually) implied answers, give the correct
00036 answer to each question. This is intended mainly for true/false questions or
00037 other types of questions where the answers are short and can therefore be typed
00038 in by the user easily.  If a select list is desired but the answers are too long
00039 to really type in, a popup-list of the answers can be used.
00040 
00041 B<Multiple choice:>
00042 Given a single question and a list of answers, select the single correct answer.
00043 This structure creates a standard multiple choice question as would be seen on a
00044 standardize test.  Extra answers are entered along with the question in a simple
00045 format and (as with Match.pm), if necessary, can be appended in order at the end
00046 (i.e. 'None of the above')
00047 
00048 =for html
00049 <P>See <a href="Match">Match.pm</a>, <a href="Select">Select.pm</a>, <a href="Multiple">Multiple.pm</a>, and <a href="PGchoicemacros">PGchoicemacros.pl</a>
00050 
00051 
00052 =head1 DESCRIPTION
00053 
00054 =head2 Variables and methods available to sub-classes
00055 
00056 =head3 Variables
00057 
00058     questions               # array of questions as entered using qa()
00059     answers                 # array of answers as entered using qa()
00060     extras                  # array of extras as entered using extra()
00061 
00062     selected_q              # randomly selected subset of "questions"
00063     selected_a              # the answers for the selected questions
00064     selected_e              # randomly selected subset of "extras"
00065 
00066     ans_rule_len            # determines the length of the answer blanks
00067                             # default is 4
00068 
00069     slice                   # index used to select specific questions
00070     shuffle                 # permutation array which can be applied to slice
00071                             # to shuffle the answers
00072 
00073     inverted_shuffle        # the inverse permutation array
00074 
00075     rf_print_q              # reference to any subroutine which should
00076                             # take ($self, @questions) as parameters and
00077                             # output the questions in a formatted string.
00078                             # If you want to change the way questions are
00079                             # printed, write your own print method and set
00080                             # this equal to a reference to to that method
00081                             # (i.e. $sl->rf_print_q = ~~&printing_routine_q)
00082 
00083     rf_print_a              # reference to any subroutine which should
00084                             # take ($self, @answers) as parameters and
00085                             # output the answers in a formatted string.
00086                             # If you want to change the way answers are
00087                             # printed, write your own print method and set
00088                             # this equal to a reference to to that method
00089                             # (i.e. $sl->rf_print_a = ~~&printing_routine_a)
00090 
00091     ra_pop_up_list          # Field used in sub classes that use pop_up_list_print_q
00092                             # to format the questions. (Placing a pop_up_list next to
00093                             # each question instead of an answer blank.
00094                             # It is initialized to
00095                             # => [no_answer =>'  ?', T => 'True', F => 'False']
00096 
00097     ans_rule_len            # field which can be used in the question printing routines
00098                             # to determine the length of the answer blanks before the questions.
00099 
00100 =head3 Methods
00101 
00102     qa( array )             # accepts an array of strings which can be used
00103                             # for questions and answers
00104 
00105     extra( array )          # accepts an array of strings which can be used
00106                             # as extra answers
00107 
00108     print_q                 # yields a formatted string of question to be
00109                             # matched with answer blanks
00110     print_a                 # yields a formatted string of answers
00111 
00112     choose([3, 4], 1)       # chooses questions indexed 3 and 4 and one other
00113                             # randomly
00114     choose_extra([3, 4], 1) # choooses extra answers indexed 3 and 4 and one
00115                             # other
00116     makeLast( array )       # accepts an array of strings (like qa) which will
00117                             # be forced to the end of the list of answers.
00118 
00119     ra_correct_ans          # outputs a reference to the array of correct answers
00120     correct_ans             # outputs a concatenated string of correct answers (only for Multiple)
00121 
00122 =head2 Usage
00123 
00124     None -- see SYNOPSIS above
00125 
00126 
00127 =cut
00128

00130     be_strict();
00131 }

00140 my %fields = (
00141             questions           =>  undef,
00142             answers             =>  undef,
00143             extras              =>  undef,
00144             selected_q          =>  undef,
00145             selected_a          =>  undef,
00146             selected_e          =>  undef,
00147             ans_rule_len        =>  undef,
00148             ra_pop_up_list      =>  undef,
00149             rf_print_q          =>  undef,
00150             rf_print_a          =>  undef,
00151             slice               =>  undef,
00152             shuffle             =>  undef,
00153             inverted_shuffle    =>  undef,
00154             rand_gen            =>  undef,
00155 );

00157 #used to initialize variables and create an instance of the class
00158 sub new {
00159     my $class = shift;
00160     my $seed  = shift;
00161 
00162     warn "ChoiceList requires a random number: new ChoiceList(random(1,2000,1)" unless defined $seed;
00163 
00164     my $self = {    _permitted => \%fields,
00165 
00166                 questions           => [],
00167                 answers             => [],
00168                 extras              => [],
00169                 selected_q          => [],
00170                 selected_a          => [],
00171                 selected_e          => [],
00172                 ans_rule_len        =>  4,
00173                 ra_pop_up_list      => [no_answer =>'  ?', T => 'True', F => 'False'],
00174                 rf_print_q          =>  0,
00175                 rf_print_a          =>  0,
00176                 slice               => [],
00177                 shuffle             => [],
00178                 inverted_shuffle    => [],
00179                 rand_gen            => new PGrandom,
00180     };
00181 
00182     bless $self, $class;
00183 
00184     $self->{rand_gen}->srand($seed);
00185 
00186     $self->{rf_print_q} = shift;
00187     $self->{rf_print_a} = shift;
00188 
00189     return $self;
00190 }

00214     # doing nothing about destruction, hope that isn't dangerous

00218 # *** Utility methods ***
00219 
00220 #internal
00221 #choose k random numbers out of n
00222 sub NchooseK {
00223     my $self = shift;
00224     my ($n, $k) = @_;
00225 
00226     die "method NchooseK: n = $n cannot be less than k=$k\n
00227          You probably did a 'choose($k)' with only $n questions!" if $k > $n;
00228 
00229     my @array = 0..($n-1);
00230     my @out = ();
00231 
00232     while (@out < $k) {
00233         push(@out, splice(@array, $self->{rand_gen}->random(0, $#array, 1), 1) );
00234     }
00235 
00236     return @out;
00237 }
00238 #internal
00239 #return an array of random numbers
00240 sub shuffle {
00241     my $self = shift;
00242     my $i = @_;
00243     my @out = $self->NchooseK($i, $i);
00244 
00245     return @out;
00246 }
00247 
00248 
00249 # *** Utility subroutines ***
00250 
00251 #internal
00252 #swap subscripts with their respective values
00253 sub invert {
00254     my @array = @_;
00255     my @out = ();
00256 
00257     for (my $i=0; $i<@array; $i++) {
00258         $out[$array[$i]] = $i;
00259     }
00260 
00261     return @out;
00262 }
00263 #internal
00264 #slice of the alphabet
00265 sub ALPHABET {
00266     return ('A'..'ZZ')[@_];
00267 }
00268 
00269 #given a universe of subscripts and a subset of the universe,
00270 #return the complement of that set in the universe
00271 sub complement {
00272     my $ra_univ = shift;
00273     my $ra_set = shift;
00274     my @univ = @$ra_univ;
00275     my @set = @$ra_set;
00276 
00277     my %set = ();
00278 
00279     foreach my $i (@set) {
00280         $set{$i} = 1;
00281     }
00282 
00283     my @out = ();
00284 
00285     foreach my $i (@univ) {
00286         push(@out, $i) unless exists( $set{$i} );
00287     }
00288 
00289     return @out;
00290 }

00294 # *** Input and Output subroutines ***
00295 #From here down are the ones that should be overloaded by sub-classes
00296 
00297 #Input answers
00298 #defaults to inputting 'question', 'answer', 'question', etc (should be overloaded for other types of questions)
00299 
00300 =head3      qa
00301        Usage:    $ml->qa( qw( question1 answer1 question2 answer2   ) );
00302        
00303 =cut
00304 
00305 sub qa {
00306     my $self = shift;
00307     my @questANDanswer = @_;
00308 
00309     while (@questANDanswer) {
00310         push (@{ $self->{questions} }, shift(@questANDanswer) );
00311         push (@{ $self->{answers} },   shift(@questANDanswer) );
00312     }
00313 }
00314 
00315 #Input extra answers  -- not to be confused with access method extras below
00316 sub extra {
00317     my $self = shift;
00318     push(@{ $self->{extras} }, @_); #pushing allows multiple calls without overwriting old "extras"
00319 }
00320 
00321 
00322 #Output questions
00323 #Doesn't do actual output, refers to method given in call to 'new' (rf_print_q)
00324 
00325 sub print_q {
00326     my $self = shift;
00327 
00328     &{ $self->{rf_print_q} }( $self, @{ $self->{selected_q} } );
00329 }
00330 
00331 #Output answers
00332 #Doesn't do actual output, refers to method given in call to 'new' (rf_print_a)
00333 sub print_a {
00334     my $self = shift;
00335 
00336     &{ $self->{rf_print_a} }( $self, @{ $self->{selected_a} } );
00337 }
00338 
00339 #return array of answers to be checked against the students answers
00340 #defaults to returning the actual selected answers (should be overloaded for other types of answers)
00341 sub ra_correct_ans {
00342     my $self = shift;
00343     return $self->{selected_a};
00344 }
00345 
00346 =head3 cmp
00347 
00348     Usage    ANS($ml -> cmp);
00349     
00350 provides a MathObject like comparison method
00351 returns a string of comparison methods for checking the list object
00352 
00353 =cut 
00354 
00355 sub cmp { 
00356     my $self = shift;
00357     my @answers = @{$self->{selected_a}};
00358     @answers = map {Value::makeValue($_)} @answers; # make sure answers are all MathObjects
00359     @answers = map {$_->cmp} @answers;              # replace the MathObjects by their AnswerEvaluators
00360     return @answers;
00361 }
00362 
00363 #Match and Select return references to arrays while Multiple justs returns a string
00364 #so Match and Select use ra_correct_ans while Multiple uses correct_ans
00365 sub correct_ans {
00366     warn "Match and/or Select do not use correct_ans.\nYou should use ra_correct_ans instead.";
00367 }

00369 # *** Question and Answer Manipulation Subroutines ***
00370 
00371 
00372 #calls methods that deal with list specific methods of picking random questions and answers
00373 #mainly exists for backward compatibility and to hide some of the activity from the naive user
00374 sub choose {
00375     my $self = shift;
00376     my @input = @_;
00377 
00378     $self->getRandoms(scalar(@{$self->{questions}}), @input);   #pick random numbers
00379     $self->selectQA();          #select questions and answers
00380     $self->dumpExtra();         #dump extra answers into "extras"
00381     $self->condense();          #eliminate duplicate answers"
00382 }
00383 
00384 #randomly inserts the selected extra answers into selected_a and
00385 #updates inverted_shuffle accordingly
00386 sub choose_extra {
00387     my $self = shift;
00388     my @input = @_;
00389 
00390     $self->getRandoms(scalar(@{ $self->{extras} }), @input);
00391     $self->{selected_e} = [ @{ $self->{extras} }[ @{ $self->{slice} }[ @{ $self->{shuffle} } ] ] ];
00392     my $length = 0;
00393 
00394     my $random = 0;
00395     foreach my $extra_ans ( invert(@{ $self->{shuffle} }) ) {
00396         #warn "Selected Answers: @{ $self->{selected_a} }<BR>
00397         #      Inverted Shuffle: @{ $self->{inverted_shuffle} }<BR>
00398         #      Random: $random";
00399         $random = $self->{rand_gen}->random(0, scalar(@{ $self->{selected_a} }), 1);
00400         for (my $pos = 0; $pos < @{ $self->{inverted_shuffle} }; $pos++) {
00401             @{ $self->{inverted_shuffle} }[$pos]++ unless @{ $self->{inverted_shuffle} }[$pos] < $random;
00402         }
00403         my @temp = ( @{ $self->{selected_a} }[0..$random-1], @{ $self->{selected_e} }[$extra_ans], @{$self->{selected_a} }[$random..$#{ $self->{selected_a} } ] );
00404         @{ $self->{selected_a} } = @temp;
00405     }
00406 }
00407 
00408 #create random @slice and @shuffle to randomize questions and answers
00409 sub getRandoms {
00410     my $self = shift;
00411     my $N = shift;
00412     my @input = @_;
00413     my $K = 0;
00414 
00415     my @fixed_choices = (); # questions forced by the user
00416     foreach my $i (@input) { #input is of the form ([3, 5, 6], 3)
00417         if (ref($i) eq 'ARRAY') {
00418             push(@fixed_choices, @{$i});
00419         } else {
00420             $K += $i;
00421         }
00422     }
00423 
00424 #   my $N = @{ $self->{questions} };
00425     my @remaining = complement( [0..$N-1], [@fixed_choices] );
00426 
00427     my @slice = @fixed_choices;
00428     push (@slice, @remaining[ $self->NchooseK(scalar(@remaining), $K) ] ); #slice of remaing choices
00429     @slice = @slice[ $self->NchooseK( scalar(@slice), scalar(@slice) ) ]; #randomize the slice (the questions)
00430 
00431     #shuffle will be used to randomize the answers a second time (so they don't coincide with the questions)
00432     my @shuffle = $self->NchooseK( scalar(@slice), scalar(@slice) );
00433 
00434     $self->{slice} = \@slice; #keep track of the slice and shuffle
00435     $self->{shuffle} = \@shuffle;
00436 }
00437 
00438 #select questions and answers according to slice and shuffle
00439 sub selectQA {
00440     my $self = shift;
00441 
00442     $self->{selected_q} = [ @{ $self->{questions} }[ @{ $self->{slice} } ] ];
00443     $self->{selected_a} = [ @{ $self->{answers} }[@{ $self->{slice} }[@{ $self->{shuffle} } ] ] ];
00444     $self->{inverted_shuffle} = [ invert(@{ $self->{shuffle} }) ];
00445 }
00446 
00447 #dump unused answers into list of extra answers
00448 sub dumpExtra {
00449     my $self = shift;
00450     my @more_extras = complement([0..scalar(@{ $self->{answers} })-1], [@{ $self->{slice} }]);
00451     push( @{ $self->{extras} }, @{ $self->{answers} }[@more_extras] );
00452 }
00453 
00454 #Allows answers to be added to the end of the selected answers
00455 #This can be used to force answers like "None of the above" and/or "All of the above" to still occur at the
00456 #end of the list instead of being randomized like the rest of the answers
00457 sub makeLast {
00458     my $self = shift;
00459     my @input = @_;
00460 
00461     push(@{ $self->{selected_a} }, @input);
00462     $self->condense();  #make sure that the user has not accidentally forced a duplicate answer
00463                 #note: condense was changed to eliminate the first occurence of a duplicate
00464                 #instead of the last occurence so that it could be used in this case and
00465                 #would not negate the fact that one of the answers needs to be at the end
00466 }
00467

00469 #point to one and only one copy of that answer

00473 #       for (my $inner = $outer+1; $inner < @{ $self->{selected_a} }; $inner++) {

00477 # 
00478 #               #the values of inverted_shuffle point to the position elements in selected_a
00479 #               #so in order to delete something from selected_a, each element with a position
00480 #               #greater than $outer must have its position be decremented by one
00481 #               $inner--; #$inner must be greater than outer so decrement $inner first

00484 #                       @{ $self->{inverted_shuffle} }[$pos] = $inner;
00485 #                   } elsif ( @{ $self->{inverted_shuffle} }[$pos] > $outer ) {
00486 #                       @{ $self->{inverted_shuffle} }[$pos]--;
00487 #                   }
00488 #               }
00489 #               #we just changed a bunch of pointers so we need to go back over the same answers again
00490 #               #(so we decrement $inner (which we already did) and $outer to counter-act the for loop))
00491 #               #this could probably be done slightly less hackish with while loops instead of for loops
00492 #               #$outer--;
00493 #           }
00494 #       }

00497 
00498 #re-written RDV 10/4/2000
00499 #Eliminates duplicate answers and rearranges inverted_shuffle so that all questions with the same answer
00500 #point to one and only one copy of that answer
00501 sub condense {
00502     my $self = shift;
00503     my ($outer, $inner) = (0, 0);
00504     my $repeat = 0;
00505 
00506     while ($outer < @{ $self->{selected_a} }) {
00507         $inner = $outer + 1;
00508         $repeat = 0; #loop again if we find a match
00509         while ($inner < @{ $self->{selected_a}}) {
00510             $repeat = 0; #loop again if we find a match
00511             if (@{ $self->{selected_a} }[$outer] eq @{$self->{selected_a} }[$inner]) {
00512 
00513                 #then delete the duplicate answer at subscript $outer by combining everything before and after it
00514                 @{ $self->{selected_a} } = ( @{ $self->{selected_a} }[0..$outer-1], @{ $self->{selected_a} }[$outer+1..$#{ $self->{selected_a} }] );
00515 
00516                 #the values of inverted_shuffle to point the _subscript_ of elements in selected_a
00517                 #so in order to delete something from selected_a, each element with a subscript
00518                 #greater than $outer (where the deletion occurred) must have its position decremented by one
00519                 #This also means we need to "slide" $inner down so that it points to the new position
00520                 #of the duplicate answer
00521                 $inner--;
00522 
00523                 for (my $pos = 0; $pos < @{ $self->{inverted_shuffle} }; $pos++) {
00524                     if ( @{ $self->{inverted_shuffle} }[$pos] == $outer) {
00525                         @{ $self->{inverted_shuffle} }[$pos] = $inner;
00526                     } elsif ( @{ $self->{inverted_shuffle} }[$pos] > $outer ) {
00527                         @{ $self->{inverted_shuffle} }[$pos]--;
00528                     }
00529                 }
00530 
00531                 #because we just changed the element that $outer points to
00532                 #we need to run throught the loop to make sure that the new value at $outer has
00533                 #no duplicates as well
00534                 #This means that we don't want to increment either counter (and we need to reset $inner)
00535                 $repeat = 1;
00536                 $inner = $outer + 1;
00537             }
00538             $inner++ unless $repeat;
00539         }
00540         $outer++ unless $repeat;
00541     }
00542 }
00543

00547 sub questions {
00548     my $self = shift;
00549     my $type = ref($self) || die "$self is not an object";
00550     unless (exists $self->{questions} ) {
00551         die "Can't find questions field in object of class $type";
00552     }
00553     
00554     if (@_) {
00555         return $self->{questions} = shift;
00556     } else {
00557         return $self->{questions}
00558     }
00559 }
00560 
00561 sub answers {
00562     my $self = shift;
00563     my $type = ref($self) || die "$self is not an object";
00564     unless (exists $self->{answers} ) {
00565         die "Can't find answers field in object of class $type";
00566     }
00567     
00568     if (@_) {
00569         return $self->{answers} = shift;
00570     } else {
00571         return $self->{answers}
00572     }
00573 }
00574 sub extras {
00575     my $self = shift;

00577     unless (exists $self->{extras} ) {
00578         die "Can't find extras field in object of class $type";
00579     }
00580     
00581     if (@_) {
00582         return $self->{extras} = shift;
00583     } else {
00584         return $self->{extras}
00585     }
00586 }
00587 sub selected_q {
00588     my $self = shift;

00590     unless (exists $self->{selected_q} ) {
00591         die "Can't find selected_q field in object of class $type";
00592     }
00593     
00594     if (@_) {
00595         return $self->{selected_q} = shift;
00596     } else {
00597         return $self->{selected_q}
00598     }
00599 }
00600 sub selected_a {

00603     unless (exists $self->{selected_a} ) {
00604         die "Can't find selected_a field in object of class $type";
00605     }
